comment: I took this class online for the Summer semester and I loved the class and Dr. Sinha! We had a total of 5 discussion posts and a group case study. She does grade kind of hard but just do your research, follow her grading criteria and you'll get an A! She also gives great feedback to each assignment to help you improve.

I don't even know what I got in the class yet (I'm assuming an A) but I really appreciated Dr. Sinha and the course. The tests aren't hard if you read the book, and she gives incredible feedback on the interim paper so that you can get an A on the group project final paper. I would take her if you have the chance to!

Pay attention to due dates and listen to her feedback and you'll do fine. The majority of the work comes from the group project, so if every team member carries their weight, it will be easy. Hate her exams, but she offers extra credit so take advantage of it. Fast grader, responsive, and will go out of her way to help you.

Dr. Sinha may be the best professor i've had at KSU. Her passion is contagious and she really cares about her students success. There is a semester-long group project but she gives good feedback and allows you to make corrections before turning in the final project. I would not say the Textbook is required, I did not use it that much. TAKE HER!

BY FAR one of the best professors I've had at KSU. If you are looking for a prof. who actually cares about you as a student, DO NOT miss an opportunity to take one of her classes. She truly wants you to get the most out of your time at KSU and will push you to excel both in & out of her classroom. Will go above and beyond for her students!

Dr. Sinha's lectures were always active, engaging, and you could tell how passionate she was about the class every single day. The over arching group project was immense, but broken up throughout the year and reinforced by classroom lectures. There are ample opportunities to succeed in her class. Post graduation, she has continued to help.

Dr. Sinha has to be one of the best professors that I took. She keeps things interesting and current. She gave my group the chance to increase our professional portfolio by presenting in the Atlantic Marketing Conference. This class isn't an easy A, you'll work for it but you'll get so much out of it.

The class was not difficult but listening and taking notes will guarantee an A. Communicate with her because she is quick to respond unlike most professors. She does not embarrass you if your presentation isnt real smooth(me) id anything she is like a wingman. Shes fair with grading and passionate about her students. Just do your part !

Dr. Sinha is a really great professor! She is passionate about what she teaches and is extremely knowledgeable about this class. There is a lot of work to do in this class but she tells you that upfront. Her class changed the way I look at the global impact of business practices. If you want a bs class don't take Sinha.
rating_tags: Accessible outside class--Skip class? You won't pass.--Group projects

comment: It's an online class. Her quizzes have 5 questions and one hour, while the tests are 50 questions and 36 minutes. She makes things unnecessarily hard and changings her grading criteria mid semester. She's a tough grade about everything, mostly grammar. She makes you work for your passing grade.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Group projects--Tough grader

comment: So far having a terrible experience with this professor. She is very quick to send lots of emails but when you send her one she never responds. Makes the work harder than it should be and grades on petty stuff. Wouldnt recommend.

The semester long paper is nearly 50% of your grade. So make sure your group is strong and organized. You can make an A in her class, you just have to work a bit extra for it. Other than that shes an amazing teacher that makes class interesting every day. Multiple extra credit options.
Dr. Sinha is passionate and insightful. Provides great feedback, but makes you work for your grade. If you take the class seriously, you will enjoy it and learn valuable information.

Dr. Sinha was one of THE BEST teachers I've had at KSU. Really engages you in class and definitely knows everything there is to know about international marketing. If you enjoy this subject TAKE HER! Every class was interesting and enjoyable. Makes you work for your grade but you come out learning a ton. Go to class! 10/10 professor

This is the worst experience for an online class I've ever had. Grading and explanations make no sense. Very clear that she grades based on how she feels. Treats this as a grad-level English class, tons of busywork, and ridiculously slow at grading. Often takes 10 points off for minimal grammar errors, when praising perfect research. DON'T TAKE.

Avoid! Grading not consistent with the syllabus, w/ examples for projects that do not portray the depth of answers/writing she is expecting, in addition to extreme page limits, making research projects difficult. Her grading does not provide justification for why you received a certain score. Lots of busywork and a burden of a class.

Chapter quizzes, Newsline, Group discussion, and Group projects. She spaces everything out so you're not overwhelmed but the exams are difficult. Very small details and examples from the books - similar to the chapter quizzes though. Make sure you get a good group for the group project it's a huge chunk of your grade. Extra credit for attendance

Chapter quizzes, Newsline, Group discussion, and Group projects. Sounds like a lot on the first day but you're never working on more than one unless you schedule it that way. Not a difficult class but be ready to get frustrated over her exams. I love this instructor, hate her exams. Brings in examples from book, and you never know which ones.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Be sure you know every example of each chapter for her exams. She asks questions using these examples and if you dont know them you can't connect to any topic related to them thus missing half the questions on each exam. I wish she would test on the topics and not examples. Otherwise, i do enjoy her class and the projects are quite easy.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Professor Sinha was a great professor. She is from India so she really opens your minds to the international world of business. Don't skip class, you get extra credit. Plus, she favors the students that aren't slackers and trust me you want that! Pick a GOOD group, its a tedious and important project you have. She was extremely helpful. Take her!!!

Professor Sinha isn't the easiest professor, but she is understanding and will work with you no matter what the circumstances are! You can tell she is passionate about the subject and likes to have a relationship with her students, so attendance is required! I would absolutely take her again!!

Attendance is not mandatory, but your grade suffers if you are not there and you miss out on bonus points on exams. Exams were MC, no essay and she provides a Practice test before to help review. Pick a good group, you have 2 projects with them! Buy the book you won't get everything you need from lectures alone. All quizzes online and open book.
